channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: US Economic Outlook Significantly Stronger Than You’d Think
item.description: The US economy isn’t doing as well as you think—it’s doing even better. While mainstream media outlets and grocery prices may make you feel that the US economy is struggling, […]

item.title: India’s Physics Wallah raises $210M at $2.8B valuation even as edtech funding remains scarce
item.description: An Indian edtech startup has secured $210 million in fresh financing amid a tough funding environment for edtech companies in the country. © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: How We Survived Extreme Heat in Prison
item.description: Incarcerated journalists detail the first signs of a heat wave in prison — and how they’ve coped with record-breaking temperatures.

item.title: What It Takes to Master Airbnb Accounting and Bookkeeping
item.description: Accurate accounting and meticulous bookkeeping are vital to maintaining a profitable rental operation, especially when STRs are even more scrutinized than typical rentals.

item.title: John Mulaney skewers San Francisco tech crowd at Dreamforce
item.description: Attendees of the giant, annual Dreamforce conference in San Francisco love being the butt of the joke. Last year, Seth Myers entertained them during a 40-minute set that poked fun at the tech industry’s liberal use of self-affirmations. “You are achieving, you are amplifying, you are accelerating,” Myers said. “‘Architect?’ I saw ‘architect’ used as […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: The Marshall Project to Host Inaugural Sing Sing Prison Film Festival
item.description: Incarcerated jury will choose best criminal justice documentary.

item.title: Federal Reserve Cuts Rates By 0.50%, a Bigger Cut Than Expected
item.description: It finally happened: Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell announced that the Fed will, in fact, cut rates, ending months of speculation.

item.title: Indian filmmaker Ram Gopal Varma abandons human musicians for AI-generated music
item.description: Indian filmmaker Ram Gopal Varma is ditching human musicians for artificial intelligence, saying he’ll use only AI-generated tunes in future projects, a move that underscores AI’s growing reach in creative industries. The filmmaker and screenwriter, known for popular Bollywood movies including Company, Rangeela, Sarkar, and Satya has launched a venture, called RGV Den Music, that […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Robert Roberson’s Death Penalty Case Shows How Justice System Fails People With Autism
item.description: He was convicted in his daughter’s death. Those who believe he’s innocent argue his diagnosis helps explain how he ended up facing execution.

item.title: Don’t Do What I Did On Your Next Property…w/Craig Curelop
item.description: Can your mistakes make you a millionaire? If you’re like Craig Curelop and learn from what went wrong, then yes! Craig is now financially free, with millions of dollars in […]

item.title: Here is what’s illegal under California’s 8 (and counting) new AI laws
item.description: California Governor Gavin Newsom is currently considering 38 AI-related bills, including the highly contentious SB 1047, which the state’s legislature sent to his desk for final approval. These bills try to address the most pressing issues in artificial intelligence: everything from futuristic AI systems creating existential risk, deepfake nudes from AI image generators, to Hollywood […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Could People Facing the Death Penalty Lose the Right to Tell Juries Their Life Stories?
item.description: Some defense lawyers fear that a conservative Supreme Court could overturn that precedent.

item.title: Passive Investing 101: A Passive Path to Profit, Appreciation, & Tax Benefits
item.description: Visit PassivePockets, your resource for passive investing with syndications. Do you want to get into real estate without managing rentals and dealing with tenants? Passive real estate investing could be […]

item.title: Gaming Lyft’s Citi Bike algos was a lucrative side hustle for a while
item.description: A New York Times article Thursday highlighted a lucrative side hustle that is emblematic of the times we live in: gaming algorithms to earn money. In this case, folks figured out they could maximize the payout from Lyft’s Citi Bike “Bike Angels” program by taking advantage of a company algorithm used to meet its supply-and-demand […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: 5 Things to Know About How the Parkland Shooter’s Life Was Spared
item.description: Key takeaways from our investigation into how Nikolas Cruz’s defense team convinced jurors not to impose the death penalty.
